intro: Kedrostis laxa, commonly known as the African spider flower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that resemble spiders, hence its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for gardens in warm climates. Botanically, it belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds.
